history.proof: intros WF_leA. unfold well_founded in WF_leA. unfold Lex_Exp. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type leA : A -> A -> Prop WF_leA : forall a : A, Acc leA a a : ?M1376 Unable to unify "Acc (clos_trans ?M1376 ?M1377) a" with "Acc (fun a b : Power => ltl (proj1_sig a) (proj1_sig b)) a".
In environment A : Type leA : A -> A -> Prop WF_leA : forall a : A, Acc leA a Unable to unify "Acc leA ?M1376" with "forall a : Power, Acc (fun a0 b : Power => ltl (proj1_sig a0) (proj1_sig b)) a".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
leA: A -> A -> Prop

Goal:
well_founded leA -> well_founded Lex_Exp

Premises:
well_founded : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> Prop) -> Prop
Notation Lex_Exp := (lex_exp A leA)
lex_exp : forall (A : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop), Pow A leA -> Pow A leA -> Prop
ssrfun.tagged2 : forall w : {x : ?I & ?T_ x & ?U_ x}, ?T_ (ssrfun.tag2 w) where ?I : [A : Type leA : A -> A -> Prop |- Type] ?T_ : [A : Type leA : A -> A -> Prop |- ?I -> Type] ?U_ : [A : Type leA : A -> A -> Prop |- ?I -> Type]
Wf_nat.well_founded_inv_rel_inv_lt_rel : forall (A : Set) (F : A -> nat -> Prop), well_founded (Wf_nat.inv_lt_rel A F)
Inductive Desc (A : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := d_nil : Desc A leA nil | d_one : forall x : A, Desc A leA (x :: nil) | d_conc : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), leA x y -> Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil) Arguments Desc _%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments d_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments d_one _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments d_conc _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _%list_scope
Wf_nat.well_founded_inv_lt_rel_compat : forall (A : Set) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (F : A -> nat -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> Wf_nat.inv_lt_rel A F x y) -> well_founded R
wf_clos_trans : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A), well_founded R -> well_founded (clos_trans A R)
Wf_nat.well_founded_ltof : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat), well_founded (Wf_nat.ltof A f)
Wf_nat.well_founded_gtof : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat), well_founded (Wf_nat.gtof A f)
Wf_nat.well_founded_lt_compat : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (R : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> f x < f y) -> well_founded R
Inductive Ltl (A : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> list A -> Prop := Lt_nil : forall (a : A) (x : list A), Ltl A leA nil (a :: x) | Lt_hd : forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, Ltl A leA (a :: x) (b :: y) | Lt_tl : forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Ltl A leA x y -> Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y) Arguments Ltl _%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Lt_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Lt_hd _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Lt_tl _%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
Wf_nat.gtof : forall A : Type, (A -> nat) -> A -> A -> Prop
Wf_nat.ltof : forall A : Type, (A -> nat) -> A -> A -> Prop
Wf_nat.inv_lt_rel : forall A : Set, (A -> nat -> Prop) -> A -> A -> Prop
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
Setoid.Setoid_Theory : forall A : Type, Relation_Definitions.relation A -> Prop
BinNat.N.bi_induction : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A BinNums.N0 -> (forall n : BinNums.N, A n <-> A (BinNat.N.succ n)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, A n
BinNat.N.strong_right_induction' : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : BinNums.N, (forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le n z -> A n) -> (forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le z n -> (forall m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le z m -> BinNat.N.lt m n -> A m) -> A n) -> forall n : BinNums.N, A n
BinInt.Z.strong_right_induction' : forall A : BinNums.Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : BinNums.Z, (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n z -> A n) -> (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le z n -> (forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le z m -> BinInt.Z.lt m n -> A m) -> A n) -> forall n : BinNums.Z, A n
PeanoNat.Nat.strong_right_induction' : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : nat, (forall n : nat, n <= z -> A n) -> (forall n : nat, z <= n -> (forall m : nat, z <= m -> m < n -> A m) -> A n) -> forall n : nat, A n
BinNat.N.strong_left_induction' : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : BinNums.N, (forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le z n -> A n) -> (forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le n z -> (forall m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le m z -> BinNat.N.le (BinNat.N.succ n) m -> A m) -> A n) -> forall n : BinNums.N, A n
BinInt.Z.strong_left_induction' : forall A : BinNums.Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : BinNums.Z, (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le z n -> A n) -> (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n z -> (forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le m z -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.succ n) m -> A m) -> A n) -> forall n : BinNums.Z, A n
PeanoNat.Nat.strong_left_induction' : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : nat, (forall n : nat, z <= n -> A n) -> (forall n : nat, n <= z -> (forall m : nat, m <= z -> S n <= m -> A m) -> A n) -> forall n : nat, A n
Inductive clos_trans (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t_step : forall y : A, R x y -> clos_trans A R x y | t_trans : forall y z : A, clos_trans A R x y -> clos_trans A R y z -> clos_trans A R x z Arguments clos_trans _%type_scope Arguments t_step _%type_scope Arguments t_trans _%type_scope
Pow : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> Prop) -> Type
Wf_nat.acc_lt_rel : forall (A : Set) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (F : A -> nat -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> Wf_nat.inv_lt_rel A F x y) -> forall x : A, (exists n : nat, F x n) -> Acc R x
clos_trans_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (P : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> P x y) -> (forall x y z : A, clos_trans A R x y -> P x y -> clos_trans A R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x a : A, clos_trans A R x a -> P x a
rev' : forall A : Type, list A -> list A
ssrbool.prop_in111 : forall T1 T2 T3 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T1 -> ssrbool.mem_pred T2 -> ssrbool.mem_pred T3 -> forall P : T1 -> T2 -> T3 -> Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall (x : T1) (y : T2) (z : T3), P x y z) -> Prop
Acc_clos_trans : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A), Acc R x -> Acc (clos_trans A R) x
ssrbool.mem = fun (T : Type) (pT : ssrbool.predType T) => let '{| ssrbool.pred_sort := pred_sort; ssrbool.topred := toP |} as pT0 := pT return (ssrbool.pred_sort pT0 -> ssrbool.mem_pred T) in fun A : ssrbool.pred_sort {| ssrbool.pred_sort := pred_sort; ssrbool.topred := toP |} => ssrbool.Mem (T:=T) (fun x : T => toP A x) : forall (T : Type) (pT : ssrbool.predType T), ssrbool.pred_sort pT -> ssrbool.mem_pred T Arguments ssrbool.mem {T}%type_scope {pT} A : rename, simpl never
Inductive and3 (P1 P2 P3 : Prop) : Prop := And3 : P1 -> P2 -> P3 -> ssrbool.and3 P1 P2 P3 Arguments ssrbool.and3 (_ _ _)%type_scope Arguments ssrbool.And3 [P1 P2 P3]%type_scope
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope

Wf_nat.lt_wf = Wf_nat.well_founded_ltof nat (fun m : nat => m) : well_founded lt

Record ring_eq_ext (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_reqe { Radd_ext : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) radd; Rmul_ext : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) rmul; Ropp_ext : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req req) ropp } Arguments Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext [R]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Ring_theory.mk_reqe [R]%type_scope [radd rmul ropp req]%function_scope
